The source code for this project can be found at https://github.com/LOAVES-Surveillance
This project was made by a group of five students at Utah State University. Go Aggies!

Loaves Surveillance is a surveillance system project. This project allows you to use a Raspberry Pi with a Pi Camera to broadcast live video and store footage on Google Drive. Recorded and live video can be viewed from the app you are currently using.
Loaves is mostly meant for personal use in the home, but could potentially be used other places. Use it to your liking.
Loaves began to be developed in February 2017 at Utah State University, Logan, Utah. It was began as a class project.
You can find more information about how to set up your surveillance system at https://github.com/LOAVES-Surveillance.

Loaves is the answer for those who need some surveillance and have a little tech know-how. There is no monthly fee; in fact, it is free. It uses Google Drive for all data storage, so it is as secure as Google is.
We hope you enjoy this software and that it helps you to keep your home and possessions safe. If you have comments and suggestions, please create an issue at https://github.com/LOAVES-Surveillance.
